oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cryptosporidium and Giardia species: Prevalence and Risk Factors in Western Canadian Cow-Calf herds. Are Cow-Calf Herds an Important Reservoir for These Parasites?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gow, Sheryl
Waldner, Cheryl
Wagner, Brent
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: protozoa
Cryptosporidium
Giardia
risk factors
immunocompromised
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The protozoan parasites Cryptosporidium species and Giardia species are commonly found in cattle feces and can present important risks to human health, with especially serious consequences when immunocompromised individuals become infected. The purpose of this study was to examine the infection prevalence of Cryptospordium species and Giardia species in cow-calf herds at calving, and to determine risk factors associated with infection.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2003; 157-158
